summary: When Carol tore off her power inhibitor while she was talking to the Supreme Intelligence I got flashbacks to when Daisy broke...

summary:
oooh I saw captain marvel!!!
it was a really amazing movie
just as a fan I was really engaged with it, and also just had a...
body:
oooh I saw captain marvel!!!

it was a really amazing movie

just as a fan I was really engaged with it, and also just had a really good time which is important with movies so I was happy with that!

the overall plot was really well written as well, I was really impressed with it and how it didn’t do the expected.

summary: Captain Marvel--Two tie-in books arrive as latest MCU film hits theaters
title: Captain Marvel--Two tie-in books arrive as latest MCU film hits theaters
body:
Captain Marvel–Two tie-in books arrive as latest MCU film hits theaters

 

As the last Marvel Cinematic Universe film arrives in theaters before the climactic conclusion to the decade-long journey culminates in Avengers: Endgame, one new book celebrates Captain Marvel, the film (reviewed here at borg), and another provides a new adventure for the superheroine expanding from the pages of Marvel Comics.  Captain Marvel: The Official Movie Specialis the film’s official…

summary:
Captain Marvel featured a Stan Lee cameo where it’s actually Stan Lee playing himself
Stan Lee was rehearsing for his cameo in...
body:
Captain Marvel featured a Stan Lee cameo where it’s actually Stan Lee playing himself

Stan Lee was rehearsing for his cameo in Mallrats

Mallrats was directed by Kevin Smith

Kevin Smith directed an episode of The Flash

Conclusion: The Arrowverse exists in the MCU, but as TV shows

Bigger conclusion: DC comics exists in the MCU

reblog.comment:
Captain Marvel featured a Stan Lee cameo where it’s actually Stan Lee playing himself

Mallrats was directed by Kevin Smith

Kevin Smith directed an episode of The Flash

Conclusion: The Arrowverse exists in the MCU, but as TV shows

Bigger conclusion: DC comics exists in the MCU

trail.content_raw:

Mallrats was directed by Kevin Smith

Kevin Smith directed an episode of The Flash

Conclusion: The Arrowverse exists in the MCU, but as TV shows

Bigger conclusion: DC comics exists in the MCU
trail.content:
Captain Marvel featured a Stan Lee cameo where it’s actually Stan Lee playing himself

Stan Lee was rehearsing for his cameo in Mallrats

Mallrats was directed by Kevin Smith

Kevin Smith directed an episode of The Flash

Conclusion: The Arrowverse exists in the MCU, but as TV shows

Bigger conclusion: DC comics exists in the MCU

blog.name: spectraspecs-writes
blog.title: Specs Writes Stuff
blog.description:
Writing Masterpost ;;;; Tag List

Call me Specs! Please feel free to ask me questions about literally anything! I love questions! Will post original writing and stuff about characters, so if you don't want to see/don't care, blacklist the tag "specs writes stuff", I'll try to tag it all with that, but sometimes I forget./Posts about my dog are tagged “my little zoey”, she is a mini dachshund and my baby./ Autistic girl and sci-fi writer - obsessed with biology and loaded with problems, but aren't we all. Hufflepuff/INTP/ace biromantic wlw/use whatever pronouns you like i don't give a shit. Heading by @procrastinatorprocrastinates, all the David Tennant pics added by me

summary: i cant wait for captain marvel to step on captain america’s toes like carol is so powerful and badass and has more experience...
body: i cant wait for captain marvel to step on captain america’s toes like carol is so powerful and badass and has more experience with intergalactic enemies and she probably won’t even mean to but she WILL take charge and steve will know that, like, he should let her and he’ll know when to step aside, but he probs will get annoyed by it but cant say anything without coming off as a little childish and i really hope theres a scene where they’re about to set up a plan and he’s about to start speaking and gets cut off by carol give me this sweet justice

summary: The gender-swap in Captain Marvel makes me so happy. I didn’t even know I needed that itched scratched until I watched: The...
body:
The gender-swap in Captain Marvel makes me so happy. I didn’t even know I needed that itched scratched until I watched:

The ultimate weapon not coming from a man! It was created by a woman! On her own! 

A 50+ year old woman mentoring other women! In the army! With no anti-feminity bullshit!

A deep respect between women of different generations! 

Women who are HAPPY. THAT. OTHER. WOMEN. ARE. IN. THEIR. MALE. DOMINATED. FIELD. 

God was it nice to watch a movie that threw out Lineage Only Comes From the Father and All Women Are Against Each Other In A Male Field. I really don’t want to see those tropes ever again.

God was it nice to watch a movie that threw out Lineage Only Comes From the Father and All Women Are Against Each Other In A Male Field. I really don’t want to see those tropes ever again.

blog.name: kittyswatch
blog.title: we watch for kit x ty here
blog.description:
this blog started out about kitty but now she's a mess and i love her that way

i'm in basically every fandom you can imagine so i won't list them all

i follow back on my main @haohaodoesshedoit

body:
captain marvel spoilers

THE SCENE WHEN THE KREE ARE LIKE WITHOUT US YOU ARE NOTHING AND THEN CAROL IS TRYING TO GET TO HER POWERS AND FINALLY REALIZES THEY WERE CONTROLLING HER THE ENTIRE TIME IS SO FUCKING POWERFUL

like she pulls the device from her neck and says something along the lines of “i’ve been fighting with one hand tied behind my back, let’s see what i can do with both free”

and we ALL know that’s a metaphor for the oppressed groups out there that have lived their entire lives with one hand or both tied behind their backs like imagine what women could do without being held back by these things the pOWeR
